Dialogue: A lot of looking. Especially at things that break the daily routine. Guards get comfortable doing the same thing every day. Something happens where they have to think, adapt.

Dialogue: The city.

Dialogue: After 9-11 Homeland Security made every city have a lock-down plan -- downtown Pittsburgh, Philly, Boston, Minneapolis -- fifteen minutes. They can do DC in under ten.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: And be running rolling stops on the secondary roads. They won't have your photograph yet, but they will have your description.

Dialogue: Thirty-five minutes isn't a lot of time.

Dialogue: Then surrender.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: Forget the local airports.   Leave from another state.

Speaker: damon

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: If you have to rent a car, find a place that will take a cash deposit. They'll still run a credit check, so use a real person's name on the ID.  Third: destination.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: Then money.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: How much?

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: Enough to last at least five-six years. Run out of money and you run out of friends.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: But before you do anything, you have to ask yourself if you can do it. Can you forget about ever seeing your parents again. Can you kill a guard, leave your kid at a gas station, push a nice old lady to the ground because she is between you and the door? Because to do this thing, that's who you have to become. And if you can't, don't start, because you'll just get someone killed.

Dialogue: I understand.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She's innocent. She didn't kill the woman.

Speaker: nicole
Dialogue: ...Good.   I mean, I'm sure she didn't.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We should really be getting home.

Speaker: nicole
Dialogue: Oh, okay.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Thanks for the invitation.    We'll try and make it.

Speaker: nicole
Dialogue: That would be great.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You want to read a letter from Mom?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: She didn't write that.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: My mistake. Dearest Luke, who I love so, so much. I wish I could have walked you home today, it was so beautiful out.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: But what's wrong with her?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She's not feeling well.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Why didn't she just stay home?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Because sometimes people get so sick you have to go to the hospital to get fixed.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: How do you know when you're that sick?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: The doctors do tests.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Luke!   Time for bed.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: ...What's wrong?

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: I was only here through the appeal. We knew I'd be moved to a prison.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Muncy is the other side of the state.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I don't have two weeks!     I need it tomorrow!

Speaker: eugenie
Dialogue: The title hasn't been cleared -- there is no way that --

Speaker: john
Dialogue: How much can they give me?!

Speaker: eugenie
Dialogue: Nothing!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: What are you doing?!   You almost killed us!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Are you --?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Are you out of your mind?!   You don't look?!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I am so sorry --

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Get away!     Get away from us!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No, it was a long shot.       Thanks.

Speaker: meyer
Dialogue: How's Lara?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She's okay.     Thanks, Meyer.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: Is it Luke?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No. He's fine. I had Meyer see what he could do about not getting you moved.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: You haven't? YOU haven't? God, John, you are too much. Luke is having a 'hard time' because mommy is in jail for murder, not because daddy doesn't spend enough time with him! Your father was right, you don't live in the same world we do.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: That's nice, that the two of you talk. What world do I live in, Lara?

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: I don't know, but it's not the real one. I am in here for the rest of my life! And you want me to believe in some fantasy that -- !

Speaker: female guard
Dialogue: We good here?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yes.   Sorry.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: Now you come here all long-faced, like you've let me down. What do you want me to do, make you feel better?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Got it.   I'm sorry.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: And now you're apologizing.   You really are a gem.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What do you want from me?

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: Nothing. You're too perfect already. You know you never even asked me if I did it. If I killed her.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Because I knew you didn't.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: Then you'd be wrong.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Shut up. I don't care what you say or how you say it. I don't believe you did it and I never will. I know who you are.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You think?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Girls love them.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Hi Mom.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I've got class.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Five o'clock at night?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yes.  Bye.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Back up! Get back!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: -- Shoot them both!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: -- I'll shoot the dog!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: -- Shoot the dog!

Speaker: thug
Dialogue: -- You shoot the dog, I'll kill you!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: -- You want the police here, asshole?!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: -- Good idea!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: -- Put the gun down!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: -- Call the dog off!!   Put it away!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: -- Release!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: -- Put it away!!  PUT IT AWAY!!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: In!   Get in!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You, too!

Dialogue: Get in!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: -- Give me that chair!

Dialogue: You're dead.

Dialogue: I didn't do anything!!

Dialogue: You brought him!

Dialogue: I didn't bring him!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Shut up!

Dialogue: On your knees! Hands behind your head!

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I can't kneel!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: On the floor!

Speaker: david
Dialogue: That's twelve hundred dollars!  Here, take it.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Where do you keep your money?!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm going to give you my money.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I'll shoot you!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You won't even shoot a dog.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Tell me!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Shoot the floor again, impress me.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I'm going to kill you both.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: No, I'm going to kill you both.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Give him your money!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Keep your dead bitch mouth shut.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Stop it!!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: See? You aren't going to kill me. That was the worst you can do. So, now you've done it. Go home. I'll come find you and kill you.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah, good shit; high alcohol content.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You going to burn me out?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah.    That's what I'm going to do.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Oh Jesus.    Oh Jesus.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Your money.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: This is a meth lab, you idiot!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No.    It was.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: My kid is upstairs!!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: -- What??

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: MY KID!!

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Let me go!!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Get up there!!

Speaker: david
Dialogue: The house is going to explode!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Is anyone up here?!

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Don't leave me. I don't want to burn. Don't let me burn.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I don't want to die.   I don't want to die.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Hi.    What are you doing up?

Dialogue: John?    Are you alright?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I'm fine.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Hey.   Hey, buddy.

Dialogue: What do you say?

Dialogue: Thank you.

Dialogue: Give Grandma a big kiss.

Dialogue: I'm too tired to kiss.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Luke...

Dialogue: I'll get lots of kisses next weekend.  We want to take him to the Harvest Festival in Kutztown, where they have the Clydesdales.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Thank you, Grandma.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Bye Mom.

Speaker: george

Dialogue: No.    Just what fits in your bag.

Dialogue: Daddy will just be a minute.

Dialogue: It's a pony.

Dialogue: Those aren't easy to wrap.  You know the party is at eleven, right?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What time is it?  Nine. Oh, I'm so sorry, I should have looked more carefully.

Speaker: nicole
Dialogue: It's no problem.  Why don't you go give this to Carrie?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Oh. Actually, I can't stay.   I have to run some errands.

Speaker: nicole
Dialogue: We'll see you later then.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Thanks so much.  If....

Speaker: nicole
Dialogue: No problem.

Dialogue: You pissed off somebody, that's for sure.

Dialogue: Put the phone down.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: John??

Dialogue: Remove your holsters, put them on the floor and get on your knees.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: DO IT!!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Tape their hands and feet.  Do it!!

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: You have to stop this.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Tape their mouths!

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: No.   Stop.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Put it on.

Dialogue: WHY ARE YOU DOING THIS?!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Because we have no other choice!! Put it on!  Turn around.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: NOW!!

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: No!

Dialogue: Okay. Tell your son you aren't coming.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: ...Where is he?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Waiting for you. Tell him you aren't coming.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: How can you do this to me?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Push send. Tell him I'm not coming back either.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: John --

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Does it look like I'm going home?! Tell him he is alone now and his mother and father aren't coming back!

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: You son of a bitch.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Get out!    Get out!

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: Where's Luke?! Is he safe?   Where is he?!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: He's safe!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Back away!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Get back!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Hit the button.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: Oh please oh please oh please...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: It'll be okay.  Look at me! Do what I say; it'll be okay; I promise.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Put your hair down.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You would've stopped me.

Speaker: detective collero
Dialogue: You want to take a guess who just escaped from jail?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Hi.   I'm here for my son.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Back from where?

Speaker: brenda
Dialogue: It's a zoo party.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: He's at the party.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: What party?     You said the party was here.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I was wrong.     She took them to the zoo.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: She?

Dialogue: Estimated drive time: seventeen minutes.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Carrie's mom. Nicole.

Speaker: gps voice
Dialogue: Time to destination: eleven minutes.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: You took the wrong turn!    It's back there.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She'll call my parents.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: What??

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: Are you out of your mind!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I tried!! There's no more time!! Any second now there's going to be a roadblock ahead! It might be there now!! If we don't get out now we don't get out!!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No, it really is fine. I can't thank you enough for taking care of him.

Speaker: nicole
Dialogue: It is our pleasure.    Wasn't it, Carrie?

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: Hi.

Dialogue: Hi.

Dialogue: Did you have a nice time at the party?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Yeah.

Dialogue: What was your favorite thing?

Dialogue: Ice cream cake.

Dialogue: At Carrie's house.

Dialogue: Oh.   What flavor?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Lots of flavors.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: My favorite.

Dialogue: Sure.

Dialogue: I think we're going to the cottage.

Dialogue: Really?

Dialogue: I have money.

Dialogue: Good.   Then I'll stick close to you.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Okay.

Dialogue: -- Traffic down to two lanes at the tollbooths. And downtown is worse. Stay away from the train station if you are trying to get anywhere. Not sure what is happening but a KPGH caller says trains aren't moving and commuters are getting irate.

Dialogue: John?  What are we going to do?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We're going to the train station.

Dialogue: Hi.

Dialogue: You're not going to nod off, are you?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Stay in the car.

Dialogue: Are you sure twenty dollars is enough? Ticket to Buffalo costs three times that.

Dialogue: This thing is very good on gas.

Dialogue: Every one in the state.

Dialogue: So, Ohio, Maryland, West Virginia, New York, New Jersey, Virginia, Michigan, Kentucky and Indiana?

Dialogue: Captain, a lot of these places barely have fax machines.

Dialogue: Excuse me?   You call this coffee?

Dialogue: Should I stop calling and count?

Speaker: detective quinn
Dialogue: I got his parents!

Dialogue: You know how many times you've lost our bags?

Dialogue: So, you just decided to go for a drive, for the entire day?

Dialogue: George wanted to see the leaves.

Dialogue: I told you.    We never spoke.

Speaker: lara
Dialogue: I'll do this.

Dialogue: Too bad you didn't find more of it.

Dialogue: That's the presidential palace.  It was all over CNN. When they deposed...what's-his-name.

Dialogue: It's starting to rain.

Dialogue: I'll call the FBI.

Speaker: detective quinn
Dialogue: You ask yourself why we found this bag and not the others?

Dialogue: Act like a cop. Grab the other side.
